title: Japanese Words in English
description: From tsunami to karaoke, test your knowledge of English words borrowed from Japanese!

questions.question: The word 'tsunami' is composed of two Japanese characters. What do they literally mean?
What does the Japanese word 'karaoke' literally translate to?
The word 'tycoon' comes from the Japanese 'taikun.' What did 'taikun' originally mean?
Which English word for a type of folded paper art comes from the Japanese words 'ori' (folding) and 'kami' (paper)?
The word 'tofu' entered English from Japanese. What does 'tofu' literally mean in its original Chinese-Japanese form?
Which word for a powerful storm system comes from the Japanese 'taifuu'?
The English word 'emoji' comes from Japanese. What do the component parts 'e' and 'moji' mean?
What does the Japanese word 'bonsai' literally translate to?
The word 'sake' (the rice wine) is a Japanese word. What does 'sake' mean more broadly in Japanese?
Which English word for a form of wrestling comes from the Japanese 'sumou'?
The word 'rickshaw' comes from the Japanese 'jinrikisha.' What does 'jinrikisha' literally mean?
Which word for a robed garment comes from the Japanese word meaning 'thing to wear'?
The word 'futon' is used in English for a type of mattress or sofa bed. In Japan, what does 'futon' traditionally refer to?
options: A thin mattress laid on the floor

questions.question: Which word meaning 'a senior mentor' in martial arts comes from Japanese?
